thread.title: As Injuries Mount, UMD Ready for Challenge
thread.title_full: As Injuries Mount, UMD Ready for Challenge

title: As Injuries Mount, UMD Ready for Challenge
text:
As Injuries Mount, UMD Ready for Challenge 
By Zach Schneider September 30, 2015 Updated Sep 30, 2015 at 10:01 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- The University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) football team is dealing with injuries at several positions and likely will not have all its regular starters this Saturday against MSU-Moorhead, but the Bulldogs aren't using that as an excuse. 
On the contrary, junior quarterback Drew Bauer says the team needs to use it as motivation. 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
"[MSU-Moorhead is] going to have a lot of energy, a lot of enthusiasm, and a lot of emotion," Bauer said. "They're going to come ready to ruin our season. That's how we have to approach it." 
UMD is (2-2) overall this year but likely needs to win every remaining game to have a shot at making the NCAA Division II tournament for an eighth straight season. 
Saturday's game is scheduled for a 2:00 p.m. start in Moorhead, Minn.
